column4: i updated ubuntu recently, but for some reason my swap didnt come with it. what do i do?
how much ram do you have?
you could see if you have any unpartitioned space left and create it there, otherwise you could resize a partition
I upgraded to the latest release of ubuntu  recently so there was already a swap partition,,, but i dont know what to do to get it back
swap is 0 but if  i look through the device manager...i get that i have 4 partitions: ext3, ntfs and two unlabeled ones (im dual booted with XP)
hmm...i dont know. Is there a way for me to gain access to the other partitions on my HDD through ubuntu? or do i need to run a live cd or something to tweak?
ubuntu needs to mount swap partitions maybe the entry is missing from fstab ?
how would i figure out whether the entry exists or not??
you will need to check if one of those partitions is in fact a swap, i dont know how to to that. IF so, it just needs to be mounted in fstab.
Thanks for the help! ill see if i can figure out how to determine which partition is what :d
most likely swap, as what could have been there before?
well, i have the ntfs winXP partition....an ext3 partition, and two others
this looks really promising... maybe ill just go with making a swap file and deal with the partition later....
